body:
### Problem

Hi, I'm currently experiencing this problem in 0.10.

I'm having this error when I use tabs as for indention.
```
Error in decoration provider treesitter/highlighter.line:
Error executing lua: ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:337: Invalid 'end_col': out of range
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'
        ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:337: in function 'fn'
        ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:210: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'
        ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:291: in function 'on_line_impl'
        ...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:367: in function <...al/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:361>
```

So far the languages I used that has this error are lua, javascript, and go.

Demo:

This is using Go.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/77670158/7176f902-e161-437b-a865-223780d15c09

This is for Lua.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/77670158/e949c46e-1059-49a6-adaa-3b5672857cc8

My soft fixes for this problem are disable treesitter syntax highlighting or use spaces for indention.

### Steps to reproduce

This is a treesitter/highlighter.lua problem, so I think I can't do it using ```nvim --clean```.

1. I did ```:set noexpandtab``` to use tabs for indention.
2. I typed ```<Tab><any first character>```.
3. Then error shows up after pressing the first character.

### Expected behavior

No error.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No.

### Operating system/version

Linux Mint 21.3

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.34.1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty or tmux-256color

### Installation

Downloaded the tar.gz and extracted it to ~/.local/share

comment_data.body:
> This is a treesitter/highlighter.lua problem, so I think I can't do it using nvim --clean.

Yes, you can: the Lua parser is bundled and enabled by default. (I can't reproduce it with your steps and `--clean`.)

I tried doing the minimal.lua stuff

```
-- Run this file as `nvim --clean -u minimal.lua`

for name, url in pairs {
  -- ADD PLUGINS _NECESSARY_ TO REPRODUCE THE ISSUE, e.g:
  -- some_plugin = 'https://github.com/author/plugin.nvim'
  treesitter = 'https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter',
  everforest = 'https://github.com/neanias/everforest-nvim'
} do
  local install_path = vim.fn.fnamemodify('nvim_issue/' .. name, ':p')
  if vim.fn.isdirectory(install_path) == 0 then
    vim.fn.system { 'git', 'clone', '--depth=1', url, install_path }
  end
  vim.opt.runtimepath:append(install_path)
end

-- indention options
vim.opt.autoindent = true
vim.opt.expandtab = false
vim.opt.tabstop = 3
vim.opt.softtabstop = 3
vim.opt.shiftwidth = 3
vim.opt.smartindent = true

require("nvim-treesitter.configs").setup {
   highlight = {
      enable = true
   },
}

vim.cmd.colorscheme "everforest"
```

The error did not showup...
I was able to replicate this issue with my nvim setup when programming in go.

See a similar error very frequently (nvim 0.10.0 on OSX, installed via brew) using https://github.com/nvim-orgmode/orgmode/commit/95fb795a422f0455e03d13a3f83525f1d00793ad.
When joining lines I get error "Invalid 'end_row': out of range."

To recreate:

minimal.lua:
```
vim.opt.rtp:prepend(vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/lazy/orgmode")
require("orgmode").setup {}
```

Sample file _test.org_:
```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, officia excepteur ex fugiat reprehenderit enim
labore culpa sint ad nisi Lorem pariatur mollit ex esse exercitation amet.
Nisi anim cupidatat excepteur officia. Reprehenderit nostrud nostrud ipsum
Lorem est aliquip amet voluptate voluptate dolor minim nulla est proident.
Nostrud officia pariatur ut officia. Sit irure elit esse ea nulla sunt ex
occaecat reprehenderit commodo officia dolor Lorem duis laboris cupidatat
officia voluptate. Culpa proident adipisicing id nulla nisi laboris ex in
Lorem sunt duis officia eiusmod. Aliqua reprehenderit commodo ex non
excepteur duis sunt velit enim. Voluptate laboris sint cupidatat ullamco ut
ea consectetur et est culpa et culpa duis.
```

    > nvim --clean -u minimal.lua test.org

When editor opens, `J` to join second line to first and I see:

```
Error in decoration provider treesitter/highlighter.line:
Error executing lua: ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:337: Invalid 'end_row': out of range
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'
        ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:337: in function 'fn'
        ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:210: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'
        ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:291: in function 'on_line_impl'
        ....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:367: in function <....0/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/tree
sitter/highlighter.lua:361>
```

So far I've been unable to recreate the error with other file types.

Since I can't reproduce it using minimal.lua (the error doesn't show up), I decided to create a minimal config in order to pinpoint any plugins that can be related to the issue until the only remaining plugin is nvim-treesitter. Sadly the error still persist.

This is the minimal config repo: https://github.com/alexxGmZ/temp-nvim-config

I don't know if I have the same problem as you do, or not.
I had this situation when I inserted a new line using `<Return>`, and then deleting it & going back to the previous line using `<Backspace>`, this error would appear:

```
Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):
Error executing lua: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: Invalid 'end_col': out of range
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: in function 'fn'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:232: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:322: in function 'on_line_impl'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:411: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:405>
        [C]: in function 'nvim__redraw'
        ...re/nvim/site/pack/deps/start/mini.nvim/lua/mini/diff.lua:1909: in function 'redraw_buffer'
        ...re/nvim/site/pack/deps/start/mini.nvim/lua/mini/diff.lua:1321: in function ''
        vim/_editor.lua: in function <vim/_editor.lua:0>
```

setting ```highlight = { enable = false }``` in ```nvim-treesitter.configs``` setup table caused it to not happen, so maybe this is the plugin you are looking for?

or maybe it is not, idk. thanks for the workaround tho.

I can produce it with this setup

<details>

```
Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):                                                                                                                                                
Error executing lua: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: Invalid 'end_col': out of range                                                                                                 
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                                                                                     
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'                                                                                                                                                                      
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: in function 'fn'                                                                                                                             
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:232: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'                                                                                                       
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:322: in function 'on_line_impl'                                                                                                                   
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:411: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:405>  
```

Versions
```
$ nvim --version
NVIM v0.11.3
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.1748459687
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info

$ uname -r
6.15.6-arch1-1

$ foot --version
foot version: 1.22.3 +pgo +ime +graphemes -assertions

$ pacman --query --info tree-sitter-markdown
Name            : tree-sitter-markdown
Version         : 0.5.0-1

$ pacman --query --info tree-sitter
Name            : tree-sitter
Version         : 0.25.8-1
```
**Steps to reproduce:**

Create a markdown file with 100 lines of '- foo'; open nvim at last line
```bash
for i in {1..100}; do echo '- foo'; done > foo.md
nvim --clean +$ foo.md
```

`:lua vim.treesitter.start(1, 'markdown')`

Now press `dd` 1-5 times in quick succession and the error pops up.
</details>

---

### Edit:

âœ… This issue does **not** occur when building from commit [`95dfb06`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/95dfb063daa709d303d0e37e86fbc8067950a830).

This suggests the bug was fixed **sometime between the last release and this commit**.

Leaving the reproducer for regression testing or verification. Feel free to delete comment.

For what it's worth, I'm able to consistently reproduce this on php by opening a large file (1358 files in my case). 
I'm using the appimage, latest version.

- Go near the end (say line 1345).
- Hit `O` to create a new empty line.
- Hitting `<esc>` and `dd` to delete it again.

Performing the same operation at line 1300 does _not_ produce this error. I experience that scrolling effects the issue.
Once it does not error, it keeps not erroring, unless I scroll back down.

```
Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Error executing lua: ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: Invalid 'end_col': out of range                                                                                                                                                                      
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: in function 'fn'                                                                                                                                                                                                  
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:232: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'                                                                                                                                                                            
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:322: in function 'on_line_impl'                                                                                                                                                                                        
        ...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:411: in function <...sr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:405> 
```

**Screen Recording: Reproducing "Invalid 'end_col': out of range" error**

This video demonstrates how to consistently reproduce the error when editing a Markdown file with 256 or more lines.

- **File:** `test.md` with 256+ identical list items (e.g., `- test`)
- **Action:** In Insert mode, press Backspace at the start of line 256 to merge it with line 255.
- **Result:** Neovim throws the Treesitter error:

```bash
Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):
Error executing lua: /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: Invalid 'end_col': out of range
stack traceback:
        [C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_extmark'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:370: in function 'fn'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:232: in function 'for_each_highlight_state'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:322: in function 'on_line_impl'
        /usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:411: in function </usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua:405
>
```

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f390dfd8-dca7-478a-b2cf-b48d6417ed90

This issue was reproduced and confirmed in my environment only (Arch Linux, Neovim installed via pacman). I have not tested other environments.

- **Test Environment:**
  - OS: Arch Linux, kernel 6.15.8-arch1-1
  - Neovim: v0.11.3, installed via pacman (package version: 0.11.3-1)

Let me know if you need the test file or the exact steps. Iâ€™m happy to share.

> ### Screen Recording: Reproducing "Invalid 'end_col': out of range" error
> 
> This video shows how to consistently trigger the error when editing a Markdown file with 256 or more lines.
> 
>     * File: test.md with 256+ identical list items (- test)
> 
>     * Action: In Insert mode, I press Backspace at the start of line 256 to merge it with line 255
> 
>     * Result: Neovim throws the Treesitter error:
> 
> 
> Error in decoration provider "line" (ns=nvim.treesitter.highlighter):
> .../highlight.lua:370: Invalid 'end_col': out of range
> 
> Let me know if you need the test file or the exact steps. Iâ€™m happy to share.
> 2025-07-29.15-39-43.mp4

**Potential Fix for Invalid 'end_col': out of range**

I encountered this issue when deleting lines in Markdown files with 256+ lines. After some debugging, I identified that the root cause was `end_row` or `end_col` going out of bounds during the call to `nvim_buf_set_extmark()`.

Hereâ€™s a fix that works for me, which I added before the `set_extmark()` function in:

ðŸ“„ `/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua`

```lua
-- Clamp end_row and end_col to valid values
local total_lines = vim.api.nvim_buf_line_count(buf)

if end_row >= total_lines then
  end_row = total_lines - 1
end

local line_text = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_lines(buf, end_row, end_row + 1, true)[1] or ""
local max_col = #line_text

if end_col > max_col then
  end_col = max_col
end
```
- **Test Environment:**
  - OS: Arch Linux, kernel 6.15.8-arch1-1
  - Neovim: v0.11.3, installed via pacman (package version: 0.11.3-1)

**Note**: This fix has been tested and verified on my setup, but I have not tested it on other environments yet. If youâ€™re also affected, feel free to try this fix and let me know if it works for you too.

(Fix was found with help from ChatGPT and verified locally.)
send a PR!

I've updated to Nvim version `0.11.3` ``` NVIM v0.11.3 Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670 Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info ``` I followed the [`INSTALL.md`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/INSTALL.md) **Pre-built archives** instructions. ``` curl -LO https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/latest/download/nvim-linux-x86_64.tar.gz sudo rm -rf /opt/nvim sudo tar -C /opt -xzf nvim-linux-x86_64.tar.gz ``` And decided to clone my temporary repository ([alexxGmZ/temp-nvim-config](https://github.com/alexxGmZ/temp-nvim-config)) again and perform the instructions stated in the repo's `test.go` file. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50f3c09c-d12f-4f10-822d-17cd5ae808d4 ...And the error didn't show up.
**Device Specs** * **OS:** Linux Mint 22.1 * **Kernel:** 6.8.0-64-generic * **Terminal:** Kitty 0.42.1 * `$TERM`: tmux-256color

> > send a PR!
> 
> Apologies for the confusion.
> 
> This was my first time commenting on someone else's issue, and I was a bit rushed. I shared the reproduction steps and a possible fix without first specifying that my testing was limited to my own environment.
> 
> * **OS:** Arch Linux (kernel 6.15.8-arch1-1)
> * **Neovim:** v0.11.3 (installed via pacman, package version: 0.11.3-1)
> 
> At the time, I hadn't tested it with other distributions or upstream Neovim builds. Iâ€™ve now updated both of my previous comments to include full environment details and clarify the scope.
> 
> For now, Iâ€™m not planning to open a PR until I can verify the issue and fix on a broader range of setups. Iâ€™ll be testing with the official Neovim packages next and will report back with anything I find.
> 
> Thanks again for your understanding, and sorry for any confusion caused!

I had the same problem (or at least closely related) so i thought i would pitch in. 

Deleting a line in my lua files causes the error

OS: Fedora Linux (kernel 6.15.6-200.fc42.x86_64)
Neovim: v0.11.3

Added the snippet to `/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua` before the use of `set_extmark` and it works like a charm. Error gone.

Would be nice with a PR @liftctrl

Hi all, I've added the small snippet provided and it seemed to fix the issue in markdown files, but I'm still getting the issue, this time in a cpp file. It seems to depend on where the cursor is in the current line.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0c32116a-5cb0-4d7e-bc80-703b33500581

I'm having this issue with .nix files too. It seems to only happen on larger files. Going to the end of a larger file and just holding `d` to remove lines will throw many of these errors. An example file where this happens is https://github.com/saygo-png/nixos/blob/a25c778f1da15f2a4d38cfe3e9edd265c3db68b5/configuration.nix

Does anyone know of a way to just hide this error message as a temporary fix?

The issue was partially fixed for me, I still had the error occuring in a middle of a 'dd' depending of the cursor position (~500LoC or +).

This is (in my opinion) related to issue https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/35099

At least in my case, the error is gone since a few days just by adding `end_right_gravity=true` to the `nvim_buf_set_extmark` call at line 370.

**Update:**  
Iâ€™ve done further testing regarding the issue I previously reported.

---

### Verified on `master`

**Environment:**  
- OS: Arch Linux (kernel 6.15.9-arch1-1)  
- Neovim: v0.12.0 built from latest `master` (commit: 78f4994727, built on Aug 3)  
- Tested filetype: markdown

**Result:**  
The issue no longer occurs when editing markdown files in the latest `master`.  
I followed the same reproduction steps I used on 0.11.3 and confirmed that the behavior is now correct.

---

### Reproduction and Temporary Fix on 0.11.3 (markdown-specific)

I was able to reproduce the issue on Neovim v0.11.3 when editing markdown files.  
For reference, here is a minimal repo demonstrating the problem: https://github.com/liftctrl/nvim-temp

As a temporary workaround on 0.11.3, adding the following snippet before the use of `set_extmark` in `/usr/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua` resolves the error.

---

Thanks @clason for suggesting I test on `master` â€” that really helped.  
Also appreciate @nwsteenberg  for encouraging the PR, and @justinmk  for the helpful feedback.  
Although I eventually closed the PR, I really appreciate all your input and support.

I havenâ€™t yet tested other filetypes or plugin combinations, so I canâ€™t confirm whether the issue is fully resolved across the board, but at least for **markdown**, it looks good now.
If it's fixed on master but not 0.11.3, there must be some commit between the 0.11 release and now that fixed it. Can you `git bisect` to find it?

> If it's fixed on master but not 0.11.3, there must be some commit between the 0.11 release and now that fixed it. Can you `git bisect` to find it?

Hi,

As requested, I ran `git bisect` to identify where the bug was fixed.

### Environment

- OS: Arch Linux 6.15.9-arch1-1  
- Neovim built from source (latest `master`)  
- Tested repository is my own repo: https://github.com/liftctrl/nvim-temp
- The test case is Markdown-based, and I recorded the results for each commit

### Testing Summary

I bisected between `v0.11.3` (bad) and `master` (good), and tested commits in the following order:

| Commit        | Video File                  | State |
|---------------|-----------------------------|-------|
| `v0.11.3`     | 0.11.3_error.mp4             | âŒ bad |
| `282f9fb816`  | 282f9fb816_error.mp4         | âŒ bad |
| `db3b856779`  | db3b856779_fixed.mp4         | âœ… good |
| `36c6f488e4`  | 36c6f488e4_fixed.mp4         | âœ… good |
| `dc87a0d80a`  | dc87a0d80a_fixed.mp4         | âœ… good |
| `a99c469e54`  | a99c469e54_fixed.mp4         | âœ… good |
| `master`      | master_fixed.mp4             | âœ… good |

âœ… According to the results, the bug was fixed in commit db3b856779 .

---

### Video Demonstration

Here are the screen recordings for key commits (click to view):

| Commit        | Description                      | Video |
|---------------|----------------------------------|--------|
| `v0.11.3`     | Official 0.11.3 release (bug present) | [ðŸ“¹ View](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/63211712-136b-4d97-ad77-3edbf86b7966) |
| `282f9fb816`  | Last bad commit (bug present)         | [ðŸ“¹ View](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4bffde93-1d61-4006-af32-7bc5115cba66) |
| `db3b856779`  | First good commit (bug resolved)      | [ðŸ“¹ View](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d5db114a-362d-4fec-a60b-acfd0540168b) |
| `master`      | Latest master (bug resolved)          | [ðŸ“¹ View](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bf02f782-7537-41d8-b257-7e3eb86bf47b) |

> Let me know if I can provide anything else. Thanks!

> According to the results, the bug was fixed in commit [db3b856](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/db3b85677928e4157d459aebb21a673a8bc84f28) .

That doesn't seem right...

I bisected between master and 0.11.0 and found the first good commit was 18e0301e1f. I didn't record the process and testing each iteration, but basically what I did was clean build nvim each time and edit a cpp file with ~800 lines generated of Lorem Ipsum pasted in and tried deleting from the very last line. Usually on bad commits the error would appear immediately. Attached is a screenshot after finishing(? not sure as it's my first time bisecting) the bisect.

Thank you, that looks much more likely. I'm not sure why this wasn't backported; let's try it.

**EDIT** No longer applies cleanly and needs to be backported manually. It's a small patch, though, so shouldn't be too hard.

Hi everyone,

Thanks to [@justinmk] for pointing out the issue with my earlier test â€” I had misunderstood how `git bisect` works.

Although the issue has already been confirmed by others (thanks!), I ran a full bisect myself just to better understand the process and fix my mistake. I only tested with Markdown files, so the results might differ from others.

Iâ€™ve documented my full process and uploaded four short recordings (two showing broken behavior, two showing correct behavior) here:

ðŸ”— https://github.com/liftctrl/bisect-log

If you notice anything off in my steps or conclusions, Iâ€™d really appreciate your feedback. Iâ€™m still learning and grateful for any insights you can share. Thanks again!

milestone.description: Low priority items. We plan to work on this but don't have a target date.
milestone.title: backlog

title: Invalid: 'end_col': out of range error in treesitter/highlighter.lua
